projects.title: Master thesis: Early design of the MOSAIC antenna
projects.description:
This thesis contributes to MOSAIC [1] with the early stage design process of the integrated, broadband and electrically beam-steered antennas implementing each of the pixels. The connected array is chosen as the antenna solution to fulfil the requirements: fully planar, broadband and electrically steerable. Fundamental studies on the antenna dimensions, input impedance and efficiency in terms of surface waves are carried out and traded-off in order to satisfy the requirements of the instrument whilst conforming to the manufacturing constraints and the optical front-end of the Atacama Submillimeter Telescope Experiment (ASTE) in Chile, where MOSAIC will be eventually installed. Among the plethora of options, some of the proposed set-ups in this thesis will stand out as more appropriate candidates for the instrument. Aiming at developing a first prototype of MOSAIC, a reduced-bandwidth antenna is investigated with one of the most promising set-ups previously studied. More realistic structures accounting for the finiteness of the antenna and including the actual feeding network are investigated in order to provide considerations on the final design to be manufactured.

[1] https://www.sron.nl/news-mainmenu-588/press-releases-mainmenu-686/4099-millions-for-intermediate-black-holes-and-ground-breaking-redshift-machine

projects.title: Absolute spectrum, Unambiguous Range, Range Side-lobes, Ambiguity Function and the Peak-to-Average Power Ratio for a Train of UWB Rectangular and Monocycle Pulses
projects.description:
The simulations of signals with waveforms as a 1 nanosecond duration rectangular pulse and
a single period of 1GHz sinusoidal signal are made for both single pulse and multi-pulse cases with pulse repetition frequencies 100 kHz, 1 MHz and 10 Mhz. The absolute spectra of the pulses and pulse trains are analyzed and the type of the pulses are indicated. For given repetition frequencies, the unambiguous range and the peak-to-average power ratio are formulated and computed. The ambiguity function concept is introduced and examined for different cases. The range sidelobes are shown and their effect on the radar performance is discussed.

Keywords: UWB, train of pulses, ambiguity function.

contributors.headline: Assistant Professor at Technische Universiteit Delft

projects.title: Etapa de frecuencia en pasarela de comunicaciones Gigabit Ethernet - OFDM de aplicación en vehículos ferroviarios
projects.description:
Low level design, and implementation and test using VHDL of the frequency stage of the complete Gigabit Ethernet - OFDM link.

This thesis was part of a joint project with J. S. Sánchez Cruz with his complementary thesis, and C. Rodríguez-Morcillo García and J. Matanza Domingo as supervisors. The project was originally endeavoured by C. Rodríguez-Morcillo in both his PhD and Master theses.

company.name: SRON Netherlands Institute for Space Research

profile_positions.company: SRON Netherlands Institute for Space Research
profile_positions.description: Lens-antenna design for imaging spectrometers at terahertz frequencies.
profile_positions.title: Scientist

profile_positions.company: SRON Netherlands Institute for Space Research
profile_positions.description:
MOSAIC will be a revolutionary electronically steerable-beam multi-object spectrometer operating between 300 GHz and 1 THz that is based on superconducting nano-electronics suitable for astronomical applications. My work on the framework on this project is to design the building blocks, i.e. the electrically-steered antenna and the MKID filterbank attached to it. Once the system is fully tested and working, it will be installed in a sub-mm telescope like ASTE (Chile). From there, MOSAIC will be able to unveil the secrets of the Early Universe, when stars were forming.

This position is funded by the ERC consolidator Grant 648135 awarded to Prof. dr. ir. J. J. A. Baselmans.
profile_positions.title: PhD candidate

profile_positions.description:
Artificial Dielectric Layers (ADLs) consist of a stacking of periodically arranged, electrically small, planar, metallic patches embedded in a dielectric. These ADLs, attached on top of an integrated (planar) antenna enable high front-to-back ratios whilst avoiding the problem of substrate modes (surface waves).

From a study on the effects of the fabrication tolerances of ADLs we discovered that interleaving, instead of stacking well-aligned layers of ADL, helps to further increase the realizable effective permittivity of conventional ADLs. This effect stems from the extra capacitance rendered between inter-layer patches. This discovery enables chiefly two possibilities for ADLs: 1) reduce the number of layers required to realise a certain effective permittivity or 2) push the limits for the achievable effective permittivities.
profile_positions.title: Intern with the THz Sensing group

volunteer_experiences.description:
As a Cara (friend in Irish) the main aim is to ensure "serious fun" for the campers: lots of fun but minding at all times the personal conditions of the campers. A serious commitment with the rules guarantees the smooth development of the camp.

As an interpreter the main goal is to help to connect the campers avoiding language barriers in this multicultural atmosphere.

There are no worries for one week for the campers. Everything is possible: eat delicious food with your bare hands, dance crazily, laugh out loud, do amazing activities like climbing, horse riding, canoeing, etc. And everything in the most fantastic location: the Barretstown Castle in Ballymore Eustace, County Kildare, Ireland.

Sharing the lively spirit of the youth with those who have lost it due to their limitations. Every Friday afternoon I spent some hours playing board games and chatting with the residents. Besides, we actively participated in the Carnival parade of the town with our own hand-crafted costumes. Also in some occasions we did excursions to expositions, nice places in the nature, etc.
